intro: Blakea lanuginosa, commonly known as the silky blakea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, soft leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows as an epiphyte on trees in humid, shaded environments. Blakea lanuginosa is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
